alert.note: Alert for San Juan (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 9:52PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM AST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following county, San Juan. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 850 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This rain is on top of heavy amounts from this afternoon. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen this evening. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
